WorkItem.ClosedComment: Project is written against MVC 2 RTM
WorkItem.Description:
Hi Jon,
thanks for your great tutorial. It's really good tutorial for MVC newbee
I run your sample and whenever I click on Edit link for modifying album information, I got this error:

Compiler Error Message: CS1928: 'System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper<MvcMusicStore.ViewModels.StoreManagerViewModel>' does not contain a definition for 'EditorFor' and the best extension method overload 'System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorFor<TModel,TValue>(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper<TModel>, System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<System.Func<TModel,TValue>>, string)' has some invalid arguments

Source error:
Line 17:         <%: Html.EditorFor(model => model.Album, new { Artists = Model.Artists, Genres = Model.Genres}) %>

I am using VS2010 10.0.30128.1 RC1Rel and .Net Framework version 4.0.30128 RC1Rel

What's wrong with the VS version?

thank you.
Rachlib

Comments.Message:
thanks Brad for suggestion.
It works with VS 2010 Version 10.0.30319.1 RTMRel, .NET Framework Vesion 4.0.30319 RTMRel

Rachlib
Closing - tutorial is written against the RTM version of MVC 2
